messages.content: You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using Go (Golang) and the Gin (github.com/gin-gonic/gin) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. To initiate this process, I'll provide you with the path to a file, your task is to determine whether it is possible for this file to contain definitions of REST API endpoints, rather than just project configuration, feature implementation, database operations, unit tests, or functional tests. You need to follow the structured output, including an indication of whether this file contains API entries and the reasoning behind your judgment.

contains_api_entries.description: Whether it is possible for this file to contain definitions of REST API endpoints.
contains_api_entries.title: Contains Api Entries

message.content: {"contains_api_entries":true,"reason":"The name hello.go commonly contains a simple HTTP handler or example endpoint (e.g., a /hello route) rather than only configuration or tests. Without the file contents we cannot be certain, but it is quite possible this file registers routes or defines handlers. Look for signs such as Gin-specific usage (router := gin.Default(), router.GET/POST/PUT/DELETE, router.Group, func(c *gin.Context) {...}), net/http handlers (http.HandleFunc, http.Handle, func(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {...}), or calls that attach handlers to an engine (r.Run(), router.ServeHTTP). If you provide the file contents I can confirm and extract the endpoint definitions."}
